verses.roman:
tomāra śāstre kahe śeṣe 'eka-i īśvara'
'sarvaiśvarya-pūrṇa teṅho--śyāma-kalevara

synonyms: tomāra śāstre—in your scripture; kahe—it says; śeṣe—at the end; eka-i īśvara—there is one God; sarva-aiśvarya-pūrṇa—full of all opulence; teṅho—He; śyāma-kalevara—bodily complexion is blackish.
translation: "The Koran accepts the fact that ultimately there is only one God. He is full of opulence, and His bodily complexion is blackish.

purport.content: The revealed scripture of the Mohammedans is the Koran. There is one Mohammedan sampradāya known as the Sufis. The Sufis accept impersonalism, believing in the oneness of the living entity with the Absolute Truth. Their supreme slogan is "analahak." The Sufi sampradāya was certainly derived from Śaṅkarācārya's impersonalists.
